Column Comment.0: INCIDENT IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for an health safety or environment relatedincident.
Column Comment.1: REFERENCE HSE INCIDENT SUBSTANCE: Identifies any substance involved withan HSE incident. This may be a hydrocarbon, a drilling fluid, fire retardent etc.
Column Comment.2: INCIDENT SUBSTANCE SEQ NO: Track the occurence of the substancerelationship to an incident.
Column Comment.3: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.4: EFFECTIVE DATE: date on which the data in this row came into effect.
Column Comment.5: EXPIRY DATE: Date on which the data in this row of data was no longer in effect.
Column Comment.6: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.7: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.8: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.9: HSE INCIDENT SUBSTANCE ROLE: Identifies the role played by a substance in anHSE Incident. Could be a spilled substance, used as fire retardant or used in first aid.
Column Comment.10: VOLUME: the volume of substance involved in the HSE incident. Note that in manycases it is more appropriate to capture volumes of hydrocarbons using the PDENVOL tables (such as for amount of raw oil spilled etc). This column is moreappropriate for use in capturing volumes of fire retardant or other safety products,rather than hydrocarbon volumes.
Column Comment.13: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.14: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.15: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.16: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.17: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.18: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.19: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
